default.description: Background color used with surface level elements

primary.description: Pinterest's brand color, also used with the most prominent action on a page

secondary.description: Background color used with non-primary interactive and non-interactive elements

tertiary.description: Background color used with de-emphasized interactive and non-interactive elements

selected.description: Background color used to denote a selected state for most elements, not including elements using "light" and "dark" background colors

education.description: Background color used with elements that teach the user about how to use Pinterest

elevation.description: Background color used with elements that float above other elements, such as modals or alerts, and only distinct from the default background color in dark mode

scrim.description: Background color used as an opqaue overlay placed behind an elevated element, not to be confused with partially transparent wash colors

inverse.description: Background color that represents the inverse of the default background color, appearing black in light mode and white in dark mode

light.description: Background color that remains white across both light and dark modes

dark.description: Background color that remains black across both light and dark modes

disabled.description: Background color used with interactive elements that are temporarily non-interactive

transparent.description: A fully transparent background color, often used as a gradient step

default.description: Background color used to present helpful messages or guidance

weak.description: Background color used to present helpful messages or guidance

default.description: Background color used to present suggestions - most frequently with monetization

weak.description: Background color used to present suggestions - most frequently with monetization

default.description: Background color used to positively convey the completion of an interaction or flow

weak.description: Background color used to positively convey the completion of an interaction or flow

default.description: Background color used to present negative, non-blocking information

weak.description: Background color used to present negative, non-blocking information

default.description: Background color used to present negative, blocking information

weak.description: Background color used to present negative, blocking information

default.description: Partially transparent background color used to distinguish an elevated element from the content beneath it, optionally paired with a background blur effect

dark.description: Partially transparent background color that remains black across both light and dark modes, used to distinguish an elevated element from the content beneath it, optionally paired with a background blur effect

light.description: Partially transparent background color that remains white across both light and dark modes, used to distinguish an elevated element from the content beneath it, optionally paired with a background blur effect

tint.description: A subtle tint placed on top of most images, helpful for distinguishing images with solid white or black backgrounds from their surroundings

default.description: A partially transparent background color used as an overlay, hiding most content on the screen while a modal, sheet, or alert is visible

opaque.description: More opaque than the default scrim background color, useful for providing even more distinction from the content beneath a modal, sheet, or alert

weak.description: Subtle gradient used to darken the bottom of an image when interactions are overlaid atop it

strong.description: More prominent gradient used to darken the bottom of an image when text or interactions are overlaid atop it

weak.description: Subtle gradient used to darken the top of an image when interactions are overlaid atop it

strong.description: More prominent gradient used to darken the top of an image when text or interactions are overlaid atop it

decorative.description: Border color used with non-interactive elements

interactive.description: Border color used with interactive elements

selected.description: Border color used with currently selected (not focused) elements

disabled.description: Border color used with currently disabled elements

success.description: Border color used with elements that positively convey the completion of an interaction or flow

error.description: Border color used with elements that convey negative, blocking information

inverse.description: Border color that represents the inverse of the interactive border color, appearing white in light mode and black in dark mode

default.description: Text color used for most non-interactive text elements

subtle.description: Text color used for non-interactive and de-emphasized text elements

link.description: Text color used for standalone links or other interactive text-only elements

info.description: Text color used to present helpful messages or guidance

recommendation.description: Text color used to present suggestions - most frequently with monetization

success.description: Text color used to positively convey the completion of an interaction or flow

warning.description: Text color used to present negative, non-blocking information

error.description: Text color used to present negative, blocking information

inverse.description: Text color represents the inverse of the default text color, appearing white in light mode and black in dark mode

light.description: Text color that remains white across both light and dark modes

dark.description: Text color that remains black across both light and dark modes

info.description: Icon color used to present helpful messages or guidance

recommendation.description: Icon color used to present suggestions - most frequently with monetization

warning.description: Icon color used to present negative, non-blocking information

error.description: Icon color used to present negative, blocking information

inverse.description: Icon color that represents the inverse of the default icon color, appearing white in light mode and black in dark mode

light.description: Icon color that remains white across both light and dark modes

dark.description: Icon color that remains black across both light and dark modes

10.description: Used for the tenth option in a chart or graph

11.description: Used for the eleventh option in a chart or graph

12.description: Used for the twelfth option in a chart or graph

01.description: Used for the first option in a chart or graph

02.description: Used for the second option in a chart or graph

03.description: Used for the third option in a chart or graph

04.description: Used for the fourth option in a chart or graph

05.description: Used for the fifth option in a chart or graph

06.description: Used for the sixth option in a chart or graph

07.description: Used for the seventh option in a chart or graph

08.description: Used for the eighth option in a chart or graph

09.description: Used for the ninth option in a chart or graph
